background_description: Born of both the mortal world and the unseen, a crossing of veils that makes you an enigma to many. You are both a conduit and a caution of what happens when two worlds collide.

Black Rose Fiddle.description: Its music causes intense sadness and immobility in nearby mortals (others are merely fascinated). You don't know how to play.

Paper legs.description: You are extremely light, and can fall a few stories without getting hurt. Try to avoid tearing them or getting them wet.

Living Nightmare.description: It has your same Attributes and HP, and attacks with claws. It disappears on Critical Damage (take 1d4 WIL damage), re-appearing again on the next full moon.

Raven Familiar.description: 8 HP, 3 STR, 11 DEX, 13 WIL, beak, d6. It speaks as an intelligent being and is entirely devoted to you.

Briar Thorn.description: It can pierce any organic material (quite painfully) but when removed leaves no trace of the intrusion.

True Name.description: Use it to summon its owner for an act of great service, but only once. It could also fetch a hefty price, to the right buyer.

Rebirth Ash.description: Sprinkle to reignite a fire that has died, or return to life a creature that has died only moments before.

Glamour Feather.description: Can make any creature appear convincingly as someone (or something) else.

Hawthorn Seed.description: When planted it sprouts a luxurious shelter, collapsing at moonrise the next day.

Stonetree Sap.description: Hardens when rubbed on any surface.

Nightdust Powder.description: When tossed in the air, day turns to night for a short while.

Hex Stone.description: Removed from its iron tin, it can absorb the effects of an active magical effect. If destroyed, the magic is released.

table1.question: What did you bring back from the Unseelie Court?

options.Description: A Black Rose Fiddle (bulky). Its music causes intense sadness and immobility in nearby mortals (others are merely fascinated). You don't know how to play.
Paper legs. You are extremely light, and can fall a few stories without getting hurt. Try to avoid tearing them or getting them wet.

A Living Nightmare. At night, you can pull a shadowy, vaguely humanoid figure from your own silhouette. It has your same Attributes and HP, and attacks with claws for d8+d8 damage. It disappears on Critical Damage (you take 1d4 WIL damage), re-appearing again on the next full moon.
A Raven Familiar. 8 HP, 3 STR, 11 DEX, 13 WIL, beak for d6 damage. It speaks as an intelligent being and is entirely devoted to you.
A Briar Thorn. It can pierce any organic material (quite painfully) but when removed leaves no trace of the intrusion.
A True Name. Use it to summon its owner for an act of great service, but only once. It could also fetch a hefty price, to the right buyer.

table2.question: What is hidden in the lining of your cloak?

options.Description: Rebirth Ash. When sprinkled on something that has recently died, it comes back to life. 3 uses.
A Glamour Feather. Can make any creature appear convincingly as someone (or something) else for an hour. 1 use.
A Hawthorn Seed. When planted in rich soil it sprouts a luxurious shelter, collapsing at moonrise the next day. 1 use.
Stonetree Sap. Hardens when rubbed on any surface, granting +1 Armor. 3 uses.
Nightdust Powder. When tossed in the air, day turns to night for a short while. 2 uses.
Hex Stone. Removed from its iron tin, it can absorb the effects of an active magical effect. If destroyed, the magic is released. 3 uses.
